data.title: Schlabach a champion at Garrett
data.meta_description: Lakeland’s Keegan Schlabach kept his undefeated wrestling campaign going Saturday by winning the 126-pound division at the Garrett Invitational. Schlabach pinned Kalib Richardson of Southern Wells in just 19 seconds and stuck Garrett’s Jaydin Stevens-DeWitt in 1:10 to open his title trek. In the semifinals, Schlabach forged a 16-1 technical fall win over Ty Maggart
data.text:
Lakeland’s Keegan Schlabach kept his undefeated wrestling campaign going Saturday by winning the 126-pound division at the Garrett Invitational.

Schlabach pinned Kalib Richardson of Southern Wells in just 19 seconds and stuck Garrett’s Jaydin Stevens-DeWitt in 1:10 to open his title trek. In the semifinals, Schlabach forged a 16-1 technical fall win over Ty Maggart of Angola.

In the finals, Schlabach defeated Zac Pica of Fremont by a 5-1 decision. The four wins improved the Laker ace to 32-0.

Two of Schlabach’s Lakeland teammates took second in their weight classes. Brady Schiffli worked his way to the 145-pound flight championship bout with a pin of South Adams’ Nathan Plattner in 3:30, a 14-3 major decision over Jose Cortes of Manchester and a 3-1 decision over Brody Jones of Constantine. Schiffli then lost a 6-2 result to Brandon Miller of DeKalb in the finals.

Ben Martin got to the decisive match of the 170-pound group with pins over Luke Bauman (4:28) of South Adams and Dathan Smith (3:01) of Constantine, and a 6-5 decision over Lane Gibson of Garrett. Martin lost to Zach France of Manchester in the finals by a 14-1 major decision.

Zac Brown placed fourth in the 113-pound bracket for the Lakers. Max Martinez went 2-2 in the 182-pound division.

Lakeland finished ninth in the team standings with 105.5 points. The host Railroaders piled up 222 markers to nab the squad title.
